Reviews.Title: “Not really a four stars hotel...”
Reviews.Author: commuticket
Reviews.Content: 3 or 2 stars would be more appropriate... 3 or 2 stars would be more appropriate... 3 or 2 stars would be more appropriate... 3 or 2 stars would be more appropriate... 3 or 2 stars would be more appropriate... 3 or 2 stars would be more appropriate... 3 or 2 stars would be more appropriate... 3 or 2 stars would be more appropriate... 3 or 2 stars would be more appropriate... 3 or 2 stars would be more appropriate... 3 or 2 stars would be more appropriate... 3 or 2 stars would be more appropriate... 3 or 2 stars would be more appropriate... 3 or 2 stars would be more appropriate...

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Marios P
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome for 5 days and stayed in Embassy hotel. This small hotel, was in harmony with Rome's atmosphere, sophisticated and simple. It is close to the centre of Rome so the access to all famous sites was easy. Room was spacious and warm, the bed was of good quality. In general very well preserved and very clean. Staff was more than polite and eager to help with all questions and necessary information to find our way through the city. Breakfast was delicious and much more than "continental breakfast" as described in their website. I truly enjoyed the stay in Embassy hotel and I strongly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Diba_60
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotelis great,rooms are just OK, Bathrooms are also OK. Flush is not too good, very hard to use.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a return trip to Rome, but underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: Mkabuku
Reviews.Content: I booked this because I was coming to Rome with a family member who had never been to there before and I suspected had no idea how expensive a decent hotel is in Rome. I didn't want the city to bleed him dry, but as always, you get what you pay for. The area is nice, nothing to be afraid of, and the hotel was clean. But the rooms weren't great. The single room my uncle had was quite small and our larger double room was far from luxurious. Still, the showers worked and we had no real problems. Reception was kind and helpful. There was a working elevator and a convenient parking garage right next door. Overall, I wouldn't mind returning there if I was coming on my own for business and didn't want to shell out a lot of cash. But it'd be kind of a letdown for those who haven't been to Rome before and want to have a special experience. Also, for people who aren't seasoned walkers, it's a bit of a hike to the major historic sites -- an hour walk to the Vatican, at least a half hour or 40 minutes to the Colosseum. I overestimated my guest's ability to walk to the Colosseum and back on foot to this place, and he's in very good shape. We ended up taking a cab back, which is something I rarely have had to do while staying in Rome. It's good as a budget hotel but I probably won't stay there again unless I'm short on cash and coming to Rome by myself.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water at times”
Reviews.Author: avocadoagogo
Reviews.Content: Location is good. Walking distance to the Termini. Price is okay. Staffs are helpful. Rooms are less than average, but you cannot compare to the American standard. The hotel (more like a motel) is in a business building, elevator is small and old so you most likely have to carry your luggage and walk up the stairs. There is a problem with the hot water system in the hotel so there's no hot water at times. We came back around 8 pm trying to take shower and there was no hot water. We waited for an hour then call the front desk and they were supposed to check but no response as of 10 pm and there was still no hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: depexmode
Reviews.Content: Great location just few steps from Via Veneto, in a very safe and central area; metro station is just on the corner.Excellent and very helpful staff, they helped us to find good restaurants nearby ; the rooms, though not large,are comfortable and with free wireless internet connection(it was very important for us as we could plan the rest of our vacation); Breakfast is good (but actually you find no eggs or cheese). Really nice hotel, have no hesitation in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “For location and a great hotel the hotel Embassy cannot be beaten”
Reviews.Author: Peter001187062
Reviews.Content: We have been to Rome many times and always stay at Hotel Embassy. That says it all. The family run hotel is so friendly and the location is fab. We love it.

Reviews.Title: “How on earth did this hostile dump earn 3 stars?”
Reviews.Author: the_melv
Reviews.Content: Other reviewers talked about the rude staff. Thinking we could over come that, we stayed here. OMG! The ever changing front desk personnel were miserable, were never helpful and were unnecessarily rude. Same for the breakfast staff. And, what a lousy breakfast it was. With an hour to go before closing baskets were empty, pitchers were empty and we were told "alll gone." The shower measured exactly 26 " by 26". A quick turn around and you drastically changed the water temp. We are travellers and used to accomodating unusual circumstances. The "free" internet did not work on our floor (3rd floor.) Simply a shrug of "I don't know" when we reported this. We were stymied by this 1 star (and that is generous) hotel with a 3 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “tiny room, no lounge,overpriced, poor breakfast,”
Reviews.Author: GillC82
Reviews.Content: like staying in a room in a tenement block. helpful reception is about the only good thing I could say about it. Our room was very clean however. good location,but will never be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Small & basic but okay.”
Reviews.Author: abqsteelerfan
Reviews.Content: The first night of our stay was a tiny room with a tiny bathroom. By "tiny", I mean nowhere to place suitcase except on the bed, and nowhere to put shampoo or soap in the shower. However, upon request we were moved to a more comfortable room for the remainder of our stay. The room/bathroom were clean, plenty of hot water, a/c worked well, wireless internet access free and fast, breakfast included cereal, yogurt, bread & jam, juice, (instant) coffee. Nothing was luxurious, however it was fine for the limited amount of time we spent in our hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good area in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Mkettune
Reviews.Content: I'm a Finnish high school teacher. I travelled to Rome together with 15 of my students, my college and my wife. We stayed at Embassy for 11 nights. The hotel was perfect for our needs, and the staff was ever so helpful. We loved the enthusiastic atmosphere in the hotel, as well as the location of the hotel. The hotel isn't at the very center of the city but we found that nearby were some awesome restaurants and food stores. Also the hotel is situated near the central railway station Termini. I recommend that - if you´re going to Embassy - you visit Via Collina nearby. The street locates one of the best ice cream bars in Rome - I Caruso. The ice cream was as good as we tasted in Florence two years ago at the Carraia Gelateria near the bridge Carraia. I chose Pistaccio with Chocolate which made perfect match - pistaccio with a bit of salty taste together with just-perfect sweetness of the chocolate. Nearby, also at the via Collina, locates the best cheese store we ever visited: Latticini. There we tasted the warm and self made mozzarella that really blew our minds. I recommend that you also try the Pecorino-cheese. As a cigar-lover I was surprised that I could find Cohiba-, Montechristo-, Partagas-, and Romeo and Julieta-cigars at local tobacco-stores - although the humidity in their humidors was usually nearer to 60 per cent than the optimal 72 per cent.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: sianelaine
Reviews.Content: Hotel was 5 mins walk from main Termini station which was excellent. Whilst not central, the hotel was about 20 mins walk from the main locations. Found all staff extremely friendly and thought that the free internet access was very good for travellers without laptops. Breakfast was basic but served its purpose. Rooms clean and tidy although shower ensuite was very small! Would recommend again for independent travellers who don't mind a stroll into the main areas

Reviews.Title: “Don't let first appearances put you off”
Reviews.Author: cathyNI_10
Reviews.Content: Bit off-putting when first approached from street. We arrived in evening to face an imposing dark door and had to be buzzed in: hotel was on first floor and upwards in building shared by other apartments and businesses, BUT found it to be good value for money and convenient. Rooms, particularly bathroom, were small but spotlessly clean. Staff were friendly and helpful and spoke good English. Continental breakfast as usual. Location meant we could walk everywhere but also close to Piazza Republica Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great price”
Reviews.Author: kpfleming
Reviews.Content: Hotel is conveniently located near Roma Termini and the Repubblica metro station, with many cafes and restaurants nearby. Room was clean, comfortable, spacious and free WiFi worked perfectly. My room was on the Via Antonio Salandra side of the hotel so there was some street noise at night, but nothing that kept me awake.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Rome with reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: aukahkay
Reviews.Content: Rome is an expensive city. For 80 euros per night for a single, I stayed at the Hotel Embassy in September 2009 for 3 nights. The room was a small but decent room with a double bed and attached shower. Breakfast was a very basic and simple continental spread with a selection of pastries, cereals, and juices - a no-frills breakfast. The hotel is located in a small lane off Via Settembre XX and just 5 minutes walk to the nearest metro station at Piazza Repubblica and 15 minutes walk to Termini Station. I would say that for the price, Hotel Embassy offers convenience for business and leisure in Rome without having to pay sky high prices.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Math2008a
Reviews.Content: Just terrible. Hosted in a building with two other hotels and offices. Terrible elevator. Very poor breakfast (we bought our own from super markets). Noisy, dirty carpets, . . .

Reviews.Title: “A weird hotel...........”
Reviews.Author: elenk6
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located in an old block of appartments with 2 other hotels. This hotel was in the 2nd, 3rd and 4th floor and in these floors there were also other offices. The elevetor was extremely old with a metal web around it, like the one we see in old movies. Our room was clean but the block of appartments in general was extremely dirty. In our room, the toilet seat and the bin in the bathroom were broken and the shower sink was plugged. The front door of the hotel was open all day and anyone could get in the building. The breakfast was limited to croissant. However, it was 5 minutes from the metro station and the personell of the hotel was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: MaciejK
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located 15 min. walk from Termini rail and metro station and 10 min. from Barberini or Repubblica metro stations. Rooms are on 2nd and 3rd floor of an apartment building with windows facing busy street. Expect traffic wake up noise around 6:30 am. There is large bathroom but shower booth is European style. Hotel provides free wireless internet. Breakfast is very good and plenty. Front desk service very helpful. We could storage our luggage without any problem after check out time.

Reviews.Title: “Could be cleaner”
Reviews.Author: mis00
Reviews.Content: The best thing was location of that hotel. Staff was very helpfull, and breakfest was niece also. But I can`t say anything else good about that hotel. I hadn`t seen so dirty hotel in my life. Bathroom was disastrous, dirty and smelly. Bath dirty, I couldn`t see myself in the mirror - the same dirt during all my stay. Some fungus between tiles. Room was little bit better, but not clean anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Footprint on the wall”
Reviews.Author: Veled
Reviews.Content: Overall impression: Just OK for an overnight sleep but not a very pleasant place at all to stay and relax for longer. Positive: Good location, clean bathroom, reasonable price, parking nearby (not free of charge though). Negative: Room not pleasant and not so clean. We had a big footprint opposite the bed in the room. No carpets and poor furniture. An unpleasant smell just outside our room. Breakfast was very poor (no eggs, cheese or sosages - mainly just bread/croissant, butter and coffee). Got rather unpleasant overall feeling after staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual setting”
Reviews.Author: mand15
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a shared building, but that is really not a problem. Reception is bright and airy, with free internet access, and staff were very accommodating. Lift is quite tiny if you have lots of bags! The room was fairly spacious and v clean, although the bathroom was quite a squeeze. Breakfast was typically continental - pastries, bread, fruit, cereal, toast, coffee, juice. Nice, with plenty of top ups, and a lovely breakfast room. Location wise, it is quite close to Republica station - but if you arrive to Termini as we did just walk from there to the hotel. It seems handier to get the metro to Republica then walk from there but is DEFINITELY not if you have luggage - you'd be as quick to walk the whole distance as tramp up and down staircases with suitcases!

Reviews.Title: “just a good hotel in rome”
Reviews.Author: world_treker1
Reviews.Content: we stay in rome for 3 nights in the embassy hotel. hotel is not far from the termini station,providing convinience acess to various city atractions and direct acess to fumincino airport. hotel is located in an old bulding in 3 floors with other companys and an other hotel sharing the bulding. on the same floor was hotel rooms and offices,quite unexpected. the noise in the morning is litle woried but anyway in the morning we was out for seeing so no problem. our room was very smal with a small bathroom,no free enougth free space in the room for 2 people. elevator in the hotel was very old style remind me houses from 60-70's movies breakfast was a typical breakfast with litle choice's. however hotel is worth the money pay for staying. also the neiboorhood is very quite.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to gossip!”
Reviews.Author: Tulliver
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by some of the negative comments about this hotel. Have just spent four days there and found it perfectly adequate for a short stay in Rome - the rooms are quite small but big enough to sleep there, spotlessly clean, loads of hot water, good breakfasts and very friendly staff. If you just want a base to tour the city, then this is ideal, being within walking distance of the most popular attractions and also the Termini if you want to go a little further. There's a good pizza restaurant nearby and a little bar down the street which serves wonderful pastries even late at night!

Reviews.Title: “OK just for a night sleep”
Reviews.Author: KPP
Reviews.Content: Plus = clean room, helpful stuff, convenient location, cheap in comparison to other hotels in Rome Cons = hotel is part of a building with other offices and all have a common entrance, very small & typical room, can hear noise from neighbooring rooms tip = choose hotel Embassy only if you intend not stay in room apart from your night sleep. Rome is a beautiful city and stay out as much as you can! I would recommend it only for young people with low budget.

Reviews.Title: “3 star?? Overpriced! Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: LadyC1983
Reviews.Content: After seeing some good reviews on the hotel I was very disappointed. When we arrived at the front door, which looked like the back end of a garage, we buzzed the buzzer and went inside. The building belongs to 2 hotels and a language school! The hotel was very old fashioned and the rooms were very small and basic. The bathroom was so small I could hardly fit on the toilet seat and I am a size 10! To thier credit the rooms were cleaned daily and the reception staff very helpfull. There is NO point in getting up for breakfast, there was no tea or coffee and when it did come it was cold. The pastries were stale and cornflakes and warm milk was not a good combination for me. Italians are not big on breakfast either so I dont expect it was any different anywhere else of the same star. The location was ok, about 15 minute walk to the Trevi fountain. Overall I thought the hotel was overpriced for what it was, I would have expected to pay half of what we paid for a hotel of this quality which was meant to be a three star (more like a one star by English standards). But we made the most of it and had a great time but I would not recommend this hotel especially if you are looking for a romantic getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Molto Bene!”
Reviews.Author: ufgirl76
Reviews.Content: I would recommend Hotel Embassy to anyone! We arrived very early in the morning and they stored our bags until we were able to check in. The staff was wonderful. All were friendly and very helpful. I was having trouble making a call back to the US with a calling card I purchased in New York. The man at the desk brought me into the office and let me try the call there so he could help with the error message I was receiving (which was in Italian). He told me that the card I had wouldn't work and would have to purchase a calling card in Italy. Once I found one...it worked great. They made the arrangements to have a car pick us up and take us to the airport upon departure. The rooms were very clean and we had fresh linens everyday. We had a great view from the room. The breakfast consisted of pastries, rolls, yogurt, cereal, milk, juice, coffee, and water. It held us over until lunch. There is a wonderful restauraunt across the street called Giovanni's. I would highly recommend it also. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again. It is in a great location and the metro station isn't too far. There isn't a negative comment I could make about this hotel. As for Rome, it is amazing and beautiful...but bring lots of money. The currency exchange rate is terrible, but I would go back tomorrow if I could!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and well situated”
Reviews.Author: groggery1
Reviews.Content: About 10 mins walk from Termini, this hotel is located in a larger building that is shares with a few other businesses (including another hotel). The staff were pleasant, gave me a choice of rooms, and had sorted out the faxes and things that had been sent ahead of me, so I could just get on with what I wanted. The room was clean, and the towels perfumed, which I thought was a nice touch. It also has wireless access for free (a novelty for visiting Americans), and this was much appreciated, as Rome can be a bit of a bore in the evening after dinner (unless you like posing on the Spanish Steps, or getting pickpocketed at the Trevi Fountain). Breakfast was the usual Italian awfulness, but the coffee was fine. No point coming to Italy if you like a good breakfast, and no point complaining about it either. The downstairs rooms have fantastic views of the street opposite, and are slightly larger than upstairs, but much noisier. This has no effect on me as I sleep like a log, but if you are a light sleeper, ask for something higher up. The location is pretty good, but wherever you stay in Rome expect to do a lot of miles. Take your stoutest walking shoes, and be sensible and do what the locals do: a sleep in the afternoon is an essential part of an Italian holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DaniPorto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located. You can really walk every from it. Rome looks bigger on the map, but it is easy to walk every where (except the Vatican). The subway is very near as a lot of facilities. The first room we got had a bit of a smell and we asked for another room, witch they gave us. The breakfast was reasonable and the staff was very nice. Clean rooms. There is a computer in the lobby that can be used free of charge and with internet access. If you have a car this is a perfect hotel since most parts of Rome you can´t get by car since they are online accessible to the population, as in all other cities of Italy. I booked through e-mail 2 double rooms and every was as accorded previously. There is a safe deposit box in the room witch we used and was great to leave the money. I was satisfied with the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Central but disappointed with room”
Reviews.Author: Jo2477
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be central and clean, but were given the smallest room in the whole place (which was obvious from the fire floor plan on the back of the door) and could touch all 4 walls of the bathroom without moving ! We were very glad that we were without kids and that we were out almost the whole day and evening each night. Although not on a main road it is close to a main road junction which can cause quite a lot of traffic noise even at night. That said, the breakfasts were efficient and sufficient, and it was very clean so we were not disappointed in that respect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Travis66
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent, perfect service, great price. I stayed in different hotels during my tour in Italy, and this was superior to any other hotel. It is well located, within walking distance of the main railway station and sites such as the Trevi Fountain, it is across the road from a bus stop, and fairly easy to find. I was impressed with the welcome from one staff member who gave me useful information including a very useful free guide to tourist sites in Rome.Rooms were clean and breakfast was quite good.Also the three restaurants just outside the hotel one directly in front and the two just down the side street on the left are excellent . I will definitely use this hotel again when I come back to Rome some other time.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fesulet
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and its location is great - a good poin to start the adventure in Rome. You reach Trevi Fountain in 20 minutes by foot, Plaza Venetia in 30 minutes by foot, Colosseum in 40 minutes by foot, Vatican in 30 minutes by bus. The rooms are very small, but clean. The bathrooms are also small, but renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Beware all Travelloers!”
Reviews.Author: larnegirl
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel via their website direct which looked lovely. We arrived and our hearts fell to our boots, it was hostel quality, with old fashioned rooms, really uncomfortable beds, no tea/coffee and the tv was broken. The breakfast consisted of diluted orange, cheqp cornflakes and some bread. No fruit or anything the whole buffet sat on a small table and every resident looked exhausted. On top of that the staff were so unhelpful and downright rude I would strongly urge people not to book this hotel it almost ruined our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ChTruffles
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Embassy for 6 nights in April. The room was tiny, but it had a double bed that was quite comfortable. The bathroom was miniscule, but I've come to expect that in Italy. Towels were changed daily, but the sheets weren't . Only one english station on tv - CNN which became really tedious after a while. The staff seemed a little stand-offish at first, but ultimately I found everyone to be helpful and very nice - providing information as required and even making reservations if needed. The breakfast attendant was very sweet. Breakfast consisted of juice, coffee, bread/pastries, cereal, yogurt. I actually thought the location was very good - if you want the metro, Republicca & Termini are only a short walk. Maybe a 15 minute walk to the Spanish Steps or the Trevi Fountain. I actually walked everywhere, and once I figured out the best route, had no problems. There's an amazing restaurant around the corner (annicinquanta- recommended in previous reviews), as well as an inexpensive internet cafe up the street. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alex82
Reviews.Content: At Embassy, you get what you pay for and nothing more... the rooms are clean but rather small, but the bathroom is very small, you can hardly move around. The breakfast is OK, they have very good croissants... :) I'd say it was OK for us, since we were out sightseeing most of day. The location is another advantage, you can easily reach by foot some very nice places. I wouldn't recommend it for romantic travellers, like on a honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Typical hotel”
Reviews.Author: anafi
Reviews.Content: Hotel Embassy is a nice clean hotel, located in a very central position in Rome. The hotel staff is kind enough. The rooms are quite small but if you are all day out for sightseeing this does not matter. It is very close to Termini Station and Metro Reppublica which is very convenient. Advice: When you come from the airport you don't have to pay 1 euro to take the metro just for 1 station. Termini station is just 10 min. walk from the hotel. Breakfast is ok. In any case there are so many things to eat in Rome that if you are bored by the breakfast don' eat it. The area is very safe because there are ministries and government offices all over the place so there are many police cars and policemans. Finally, all those who have written about Anninciquita resrtaurant near the hotel are absolutely right. We liked that there were many locals especially young ones. P.S. I didn't like that sheets were not changed in our room for 5 days

Reviews.Title: “Standard for tourist”
Reviews.Author: LesSF
Reviews.Content: This was a fine place to stay for what we needed it for (married couple in their late 20s) - we were sightseeing all day. The staff is very friendly and the entrance to the hotel is pretty neat. The location is ok - eat at Annicinquanta down the street - excellent pizza, not so excellent staff. The pillows were pretty hard and the room was small but, overall, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: Gusta
Reviews.Content: Easy to book via hotel's website. No payment in advance. Very clean but a little small room. Good cont. breakfast. Very noisy if window is open because of parking area behind the hotel. We have been here from 10-10 / 14-10-2007

Reviews.Title: “Just the job”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBStIvesUK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from one weeks stay at the Embassy Hotel in Rome. We found it to be clean and comfortable if a little small and basic. Not the place to hang around in but ideal for a good nights sleep. Breakfast is very tedious after a few days. Try to take something from home to give some variety. It is possible to buy cheese/ham etc from the local supermarkets and keep in your room fridge. Wish we had taken a kettle with us so we could have made our own refreshments in the morning and evening. You will need an adapter to fit the unusual Italian sockets. The room we stayed in has recently been refurbished but we did have to avoid busy times for showering as the water pressure was not constant with heavy use. We could also watch CNN on the TV, the one english speaking station. If you arrive at the main airport buy enough tickets for the Leonardo Express for the return trip. They are not validated until the day you use them and it saves time at the busy train station. Also buy some spare metro/bus tickets to keep in your wallet. They are a godsend at the end of a busy day when you see a bus come along going to the Termini Station and you can just jump on. We also used the excellent train service to visit Frascati and Cassino. Why pay a fortune to go on organised trips when you can do it far cheaper yourself. Return trip to Frascati only about 4 euros. Beware when out of Rome most shops/museums close between 1300h and 1600h.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In terms of Irish accomodation, the Embassy is more of a guest house than a hotel, so don't expect anything too plush. First impressions are not overwhelming; the hotel is tucked away on a side-street and shares a building with an array of other concerns - another hotel, a linguistics institute, some apartments etc. The lift to the rooms (described very negatively by the poster from North Yorkshire in his review) is a bit freaky in as much as it reminded us of the film "Angel Heart" with all the connotations of death, blood and damnation but actually, like much of the rest of Rome, after a short while it loses its weirdness and grows on you. The room we stayed in (451) was clean, very well heated and appointed with everything you need except maybe coffee-making facilities. Service was excellent (example, I walked the 3 floors down to Reception one night to ask for more toilet roll and by the time I'd travelled back to the room in the lift, staff had been and gone with the toilet roll. Its these little touches that mark a place out). Breakfast was all we needed; personally I don't need or want a big fried breakfast lying on my stomach when I'm going to be doing a lot of walking and sightseeing. The staff in the Embassy were all friendly and spoke English well. The location of the hotel was good too, just around the corner from Via XX Septembre where you can get the bus to just about anywhere, and in easy walking distance to the Trevi fountain and Spanish Steps. Our room was to the rear of the hotel so it was as quiet as possible; the only noise was from what were probably employees of the Agriculture Ministry chatting while having a smoke on the balcony of (what I think was) the ministry building. Only 2 real negatives: it would have been nice to have had just one tv channel in English (watching "Joey" dubbed into Italian or what appeared to be rather vain naval personnel presenting the weather forecast is initially amusing but the novelty fades very quickly...); and the guy at Reception offered to fix us up with a taxi to Fiumicino airport for the "special" price of €45 (okay, maybe he was just trying to be helpful, but I don't know...) and said we'd be waiting "30 or 40 minutes" at Termini to buy tickets for the airport express train. Not so: drag your cases to Via Septembre and get the bus to Termini, then get a Customer Service person (look for orange high-visibility vest) to use one of the fast-ticket machines for you. But these are minor gripes. We're pretty picky about hotels, particularly regarding cleanliness and service. We had no problems with the Embassy in this regard and it was a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Three Star in Name Only”
Reviews.Author: SFSolo
Reviews.Content: First of all, the staff of this hotel were very cordial and friendly. When I arrived the desk clerk was working very far beyond the call of duty to find a room elsewhere for a traveler who had showed up without reservations. And I especially enjoyed the colorful gentleman who mans the desk at night and is not shy about sharing stories of how Rome used to be "before Italy got rich." People like that are what make traveling, especially in Italy and especially in the less-than-luxurious hotels, such a rich pleasure. But that, sadly, was the high point of this particular hotel. The common areas were adequate, but the room smelled heavily of mildew and was furnished mostly in what seemed to be thrift-store castoffs. The mildew smell could not be mitigated by fresh air, because the extreme street noise required us to keep the window tightly closed. The poorly ventilated bath exacerbated the problem because breathing while in the shower meant leaving the door open, which only filled the room with the steam that probably caused the mildew in the first place. I expected Via XX Settembre to be busy, but the street was much louder than expected. And although I was roughly familiar with the location -- a business/government area -- I had miscalculated and found that it was just far enough away to be inconvenient to tourist destinations as well as to the Termini (although if you are in the area, don't deny yourself a stop at Santa Maria della Vittoria and the National Museum nearby). This hotel, and its clientele, would be better served if it discarded its three-star pretension and focussed on providing good, solid one- or two-star value. Try the Hotel Margaret downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel but clean, comfortable, great location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Embassy was excellent for the price! I spent 10 days here in September with my mother. You must keep in mind that this is a basic hotel, it is not fancy at all. However it was extremely clean, the location was great and the staff were wonderful. The Embassy at $150 Canadian a night, was the most reasonable price for a hotel in Rome in a great location. It is a 5 minute walk to the metro station at the Piazza Republica. From there you can reach anywhere in Rome, the colloseum, Vatican etc. There are plenty of shops and churches between the hotel and P.Republica and we felt very safe walking around. Crossing the streets on the other hand takes some skill anywhere in Rome. There are some cafes in the area which were quite nice and 2 nice restaurants basically across from the hotel. However, avoid the restaurant directly opposite the hotel, it looks nice but is a complete waste of money. Yes the first impression isn't great as it doesn't look like your average hotel, the reception desk is 12 steps up from the ground level which was a pain with all our luggage, the elevator does appear to be from some science fiction movie (it's safe, it's just tiny) and the continental breakfast is very basic. However, this is a clean, quiet, friendly hotel in Rome, which is a rare find. I am a really picky person who usually would not consider staying in anything less than a 4 star hotel, but hotels in Rome are expensive and this was only the first leg of our journey so we were on a budget. There isn't a restaurant, bar or a lobby in the hotel so if you intend to spend a lot of time in your hotel room or in the hotel in general, this is not the place for you. If you want somewhere clean, comfortable, and reasonably priced to sleep you can't go wrong. It was recommended to me and I would recommend it to others. P.S. Ask for a room with a balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a four bed room, 2 adults and two children. 4th bed was a pull-out only suitable for our youngest. Room on a corner so very noisy but we were so tired after exploring Rome we had no problem sleeping. Room clean but bathroom and shower SMALL. However, would recommend it as a value for money city hotel, good central location, friendly, helpful staff and good just to sleep and have breakfast if you intend to be out all day sightseeing and eating out.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Chester le Street, Co Durham, England
Reviews.Title: “More than satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: ewoods2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for the first week of September. We arrived at 01.30am and the receptionist was very pleasant and welcoming. We found all of the staff to be helpful and friendly. We had requested a quiet room (by e-mail) and were given a room which was just as we wanted (room 450). The breakfasts were basic but adequate and the waitress was extremely pleasant. The room had television, airconditioning and a wall safe, all of which worked admirably. The bathroom was small, but we did not expect a 5 star room in a budget hotel. Everything was very clean. There are good restaurants in a small street opposite and to the left of the hotel entrance. We did not use the restaurant directly opposite the hotel, heeding the advice of previous reviews. The location of the hotel is ideal for access to Termini. We did walk back from Trevi and Spanish steps. If we return to Rome we would not hesitate to use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: jambogirl
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is brilliant, a few street people hanging around but not too bad, we felt safe enough walking back in the early hours of the morning. The hotel staff were brilliant, particulary the guy at reception who spoke very good English. He recommended and circled areas on a map of Rome that he gave us, we tried each of the areas over three nights and were not disappointed. He also stored our luggage on the day of departure and organised our taxi back to Ciampiano airport for 50 euros. The hotel itself is clean although fairly basic, breakfast was typically continental but ok. Our room was on the 4th floor at the back of the building, which meant it was fairly quiet. It was larger than some of the other rooms as it had a kind of corridor in it. (Room no 450) Superb holiday, would definitely stay at the hotel Embassy again.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more for 120Euro!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For 120Euro I expected more! The room was very very small - slightly larger than the size of a double bed. Bathroom tiny The lift was old, small and inconvenient (we travelled with a 7 month girl) But: Aircondition was fantastic Breakfast was decent Location good Room Clean Overall - if the room would have been bigger I would recommend the hotel, but returning to a box after touring Rome is not fun at all!

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in the Embassy Hotel in Rome in June for 7 nights. We found the hotel clean and basic but fine and would have no hesitation in staying there again. We had booked a room with a terrace and when we arrived we were in a room without a terrace (3rd floor) and quite a small bathroom. Was not too impressed with this room (which was very noisy at night - traffic, and quite gloomy) and expressed this to the gentleman at reception and we were moved the next day to large room (triple rooom)with a terrace, with a small but very adequate bathroom. The airconditioning was a godsend on the hot june nights, and there was much less traffic noise even with the terrace doors open. The hotel is very close to the Termini station (5 mins walk) and Piazza De Republica. Here you will find the metro stations, and you are just a metro ride from all the attractions (or if you are feeling energetic you can walk!!). We found the area (and most of Rome) very safe and even at night did not feel uncomfortable or worried about being out walking around. I would avoid Termini at night but other than that, it was fine. Rome is a fantastic city, and for basic clean and central accomodation, the Embassy hotel is not a bad choice. My advice is to try and get a room on the second floor with a terrace. When I booked this I got a confirmation email which proved the clincher when trying to move rooms. The hotel only has a few rooms with terraces so ask for one when you book and try to get the confirmation in writing. There was no extra charge for this room. The beds are singles pushed together to bring something with you to keep them together (cable ties etc etc)!! And the main thing is .... enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Hotel. Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rose31
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome where I spent 3nights at the Hotel Embassy in a triple room with my 2 daughters one 24 and the other 14. The hotel is situated in a street about 10minutes walk from the top of the Via Veneto and is in a building shared with other hotels and offices. I found the staff to be pleasant and helpful and our room and bathroom were both clean and modern with clean towels etc each day. The breakfast was a continental breakfast e.g yoghurt, juice, croissants, coffee etc and was enough for us. I thought this was a good value hotel not too far from the main attractions of Rome and we never felt unsafe in the area at all.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Budget Hotel, Well Located”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a 5-night stay in Rome. The Embassy Hotel is well located and is within walking distance of the Piazza Republica and the Via Veneto – in fact, we walked to the Colosseum and the Vatican. I would agree with other writers, in that the hotel is not luxurious – but we did not go to Rome to spend a great deal of time in the room. This is a budget hotel, which is spotlessly clean and relatively well located. The breakfast was very basic but edible.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy - OK but not realy good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Friday till Monday. The Hotel claims to be 3 star but I seriously doubt this qualification. The front desk people are just unfriendly and unwilling to do anything except asking you 20 times if you need a taxi to the airport which gives the idea that they share some interest there.. The room whe had (331) was small but clean. The beds were promissed to be double but in reality a joined twin combination so the beds would "drift apart" . The bath room is no good . It is tiny and the shower is horrible . warm water is something we hoped to see and sometimes we actually did... The remote control of the TV was untraceable and remained that way during our stay despite we asked twice at the front desk. The breakfast is poor at least to our standards. You get a basked with bread and the only thing to put on that is marmelade or honey. if you don't like that, too bad... No cheese or eggs or fruit nothing... We walked to plaza republica where there is a lovely cafe where we enjoyed the sun and the great breakfast there... The embassy is not giving you value for your money on this level... basically it is a terrible hotel but it is close to everything It is only 10 minutes walking from the train station. So don't bother to take a taxi or the metro . Just walk down to the Grand Hotel go right there and left at the end of that street you walk straight into the Embassy hotel. The only good thing about this hotel is that a little bit to the left when you go out of the Hotel there is a street amnd when you enter you will find a nice restaurant where the food is good and very cheap. DO NOT GO TO THe RESTAURANT ACROSS THE HOTEL....... In summary ; it is cheap but also not so good..... I would not go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JdWals
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed in the Embassy Hotel in April'05 and it was a great hotel. Excellent location, just 10 minutes from the main train station, very close to the main tourist attractions, including the zoo. Always felt safe walking to or from the hotel at anytime. Rooms are a fair size and are clean and quiet. The breakfast is basic but nice and will get you going and you can always find an excuse to go grab more food in any of the wonderful coffee shops around Rome. Staff were also very friendly and helpful and we had no porblems leaving our bags with them on checkout so we could explore Rome further while waiting to go to the airport later in the day. A very satisfying trip and I would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good value budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hopeful2
Reviews.Content: The Embassy is in a good location just 2 streets away from Piazza Del Republica which is at the top of Via Nationale. It is within walking distance of Via Veneto, the railway station and the Spanish Steps. The area is full of Government Buildings so quite safe both day and night. All the staff are extremely friendly and the recption staff are particularly helpful and speak great English. The hotel shares a building with another hotel and some private apartments which is a little unusual but does give you a sense of safety and calm. We had 2 rooms which had dated ceramic tiles on the floors. These were cracked in places but were clean. Everything else in the rooms was also very clean including the bedding. We had complete control over the air con which was very responsive on demand. The bathrooms were extremely small and proved difficult to manouvre round in to get to sit on the loo! The shower cubicles were also very small and also difficult to move around in. We manged to see into other rooms on other floors and these had obviuosly been updated with marble floors etc. Overall, however, it was a great value hotel if you are on somewhat of a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and simple”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiancee just returned from Italy and we spent two nights in Rome at the Hotel Embassy. We paid 80 Euros per night and the hotel more or less met my expectations. It is by no means a luxury establishment, but doesn't claim to be. It is simple and clean with no frills, but budget-minded travelers who aren't too picky should be fine here. We also had problems with the shower in the morning but overall I'd say that our stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel good price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night trip to rome and loved it! The hotel doesnt look much from the outside but everywhere was really clean and the bathroom looked brand new and had a lovely power shower. Our room was on the ground floor but we didnt hear any noise from the hotel, just abit of traffic outside but considering how mad the traffic is over there its not suprising! The people at reception were really friendly and helpful. There is someone there day and night which was useful as we didnt check in until 1.30 am when we arrived but everythign was fine. Breakfast was nice and consisted of cereal and an assortment of breads and coissants. Waitresses were really helpful too. Hotel was well situated as it was near the train station, trevi fountain and spanish steps. We walked everywhere so a map is useful when pounding the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: CT-Travler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel this past July and as the cab drove up I was a little skeptical considering the entrance is on a small side street and there are offices in other parts of the building. The lobby was very small but everyone was very helpful. When I got to the room I was very impressed after staying in extremly small rooms for the same price in Paris, Marseille, and Venice. The room was spacious, had a nice TV, and AC a definite plus in the middle of summer.

Reviews.Title: “Not above avarage hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 4 nights. Good location, about 5 minutes from piaza republica. Rooms were fine for 3 stars hotel, no more. Quite noisy at night. There are many restaurants within few minutes walking. Part of the staff weren't very friendly. They has given us wrong information twice(Colloseum is not 10 minutes from the hotel, and Via del Corso is indeed open on Sundays, as opposed to what we were informed). One evening we came at 19:00, and there were not hot water on the showers. They told us to wait 30 miniutes. Sure it didn't help, and again we were asked to wait 30 minutes. Finally after 2 hours we did cold showers, and only in the morning the hot water came back. The staff did zero effort to solve the problem, and didn't even bother to apologize.

Reviews.Title: “basic and small with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we were disappointed with the size of the room and the complementary breakfast left something to be desired. but the staff were very friendly and helpful, which is rare in some of the budget hotels. i'd like to think you could get a better sized, better located room at this price, but at the end of the day we were fine with it.

HotelInfo.Name: Embassy Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Antonio Salandra 6, 00187 Rome, Italy
